issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: JobHistoryEventHandler could not flush every 30 secondes

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Job history file is not flushed correctly because isTimerActive flag is not set true when flushTimerTask is scheduled.
It looks like we should set isTimerActive to true when flushTimerTask is scheduled. Otherwise if a new qualified event comes before the current flush timer is expired,  flushTimerTask will be canceled and rescheduled.
Also I didn't find any code which set isTimerActive flag to true, So isTimerActive is useless in current code.
fields.summary: Job history file is not flushed correctly because isTimerActive flag is not set true when flushTimerTask is scheduled.

Change it to a critical issue because we saw a MR job whose AM container is killed and  two hours event records are missing in the job history file.
thanks [~devaraj.k] for the review, I am not sure what cause the checkstyle issue. I uploaded a new patch, which fix 80-column-limit violations at line 259 of JobHistoryEventHandler.java.

The first patch MAPREDUCE-6339.000.patch is the one for review and commit. I didn't find any code style issue in my first patch MAPREDUCE-6339.000.patch. It looks like something wrong in the checkstyle script.

The two test patches MAPREDUCE-6339.test.patch and MAPREDUCE-6339.test1.patch is to prove this is most likely a checkstyle script issue. The only difference between MAPREDUCE-6339.test.patch and MAPREDUCE-6339.test1.patch is an import statement, which doesn't look like an issue for me.
The original patch MAPREDUCE-6339.000.patch is the one for review and commit

Thanks [~zxu] for your effort on identifying the checkstyle issue.

MAPREDUCE-6339.000.patch looks good to me, will commit it soon.

Thanks [~zxu].

Committed to trunk, branch-2 and branch-2.7.
